title: James Nasmyth, Engineer: An Autobiography
author: Nasmyth, James
snippet: Still more marvellous, however, was the first adventure by train of anold woman from Newtyle to Dundee.

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: To neglect this, was held discourtesy in thegreat, and insolence in the inferior traveller; andso strictly was the etiquette insisted on by somefeudal lords, that the Lord Oliphant is said to havehad guns planted at his Castle of Newtyle, inAngus-shire, so as to command the high road, andto compel all restive passengers to do this act ofhomage.
